text: Edita Gruberová (23 December 1946 – 18 October 2021) was a Slovak coloratura soprano. She is known for her roles as Zerbinetta in Ariadne auf Naxos and Queen of the Night in The Magic Flute. She appeared in Donizetti's Lucia di Lammermoor and as Elvira in Bellini's I puritani and Elisabetta in Roberto Devereux. Gruberová was born in Rača, Bratislava. Her mother was Hungarian and her father was German. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Slovak actors Category:Czechoslovak people Category:European opera singers
title: Edita Gruberová
